## GAD-7 vs AOSI

Psychologists and social scientists often grapple with the challenge of comparing and harmonizing questionnaire items such as those found in the Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Autism Observation Scale for Infants (AOSI). The manual process can be laborious and prone to subjectivity. However, with Harmony, an innovative tool powered by AI and natural language processing, comparing the GAD-7 vs AOSI becomes a manageable task. Harmony offers user-friendly drag and drop functionality, allowing researchers to compare items in GAD-7 vs AOSI swiftly. Its advanced algorithm identifies matching items between GAD-7 and AOSI, providing a percentage match between each item. Enhanced with multilingual capabilities, Harmony can not only consolidate item comparisons across various languages, but also identify common trends or disparities across diverse cohorts or longitudinal studies. This streamlined approach offers immense potential to researchers studying changing social conditions and their impacts. We highly recommend Harmony to psychologists looking to utilize its transformative potentials in their research endeavours. Its ease of use, efficiency, and accuracy in matching items between the GAD-7 vs AOSI make it an excellent choice. By using Harmony, researchers can commit more of their valuable time to interpret and apply the vital findings from these questionnaires in their research intervention.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and AOSI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and AOSI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AOSI into Harmony</a> - compare AOSI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
